sen.j: 道長も太政官を政治的基盤として維持するために関白就任を望まず、道長が孫の後一条天皇の摂政に就任するまでの20年間「内覧左大臣」として最高権力の地位に座り、摂関不在状態が続いた。
sen.e: Michinaga did not wish to be appointed as the Chancellor to keep his political base as being the Grand Council of State, he was in the highest political position of 'Nairan Sadaijin (Minister of the left) for twenty years, until his grandchild, Emperor Goichijo appointed Michinaga as the Chancellor, during this time there was no one to be in the position of the Chancellor.

sen.j: 近衛天皇の時に摂政藤原忠通が父藤原忠実の怒りを買って、藤氏長者の座を弟の藤原頼長に奪われた折、忠実から天皇に対して忠通の関白解任を求められたが、院政を行っていた鳥羽天皇の介入で忠通の関白留任と引き換えに頼長にも内覧の宣旨が下った（関白と内覧が並存する事はこれまでありえなかった）。
sen.e: While Emperor Konoe was in power, the Chancellor FUJIWARA no Tadamichi was taken his position away, after his father, FUJIWARA no Tadazane was furious about him, Tadamichi's wealthy position as the Fujiwara clan was passed to his younger brother, FUJIWARA no Yorinaga, and Tadamichi asked the Emperor to take Tadamichi's position of the Chancellor away, however Emperor Toba who was ruling the Cloister government at that time helped the situation, in exchange to cancel Tadamichi's position of the Chancellor, Yorinaga was given the Imperial order to become Nairan.

While Emperor Konoe was in power, the Chancellor FUJIWARA no Tadamichi had his positiontaken away, and his father, FUJIWARA no Tadazane was furious about it, Tadamichi's wealthy position as the Fujiwara clan was passed to his younger brother, FUJIWARA no Yorinaga, and Tadamichi asked the Emperor to take Tadamichi's position of Chancellor away, however Emperor Toba, who was ruling the Cloistered government at the time, helped the situation, in exchange forcanceling Tadamichi's position of Chancellor, Yorinaga was given the Imperial order to become Nairan.

While Emperor Konoe was in power, Chancellor FUJIWARA no Tadamichi incurred the anger of his father, FUJIWARA no Tadazane, and Tadamichi's position as leader of the Fujiwara clan was passed to his younger brother, FUJIWARA no Yorinaga; at this time, Tadazane asked the Emperor to strip Tadamichi of his position as Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), but Emperor Toba, who was ruling as a cloistered emperor at the time, helped resolve the situation by issuing an Imperial decree for Yorinaga to become Nairan in exchange for Tadamichi being allowed to retain his position as Kanpaku. (Until this time, it had not been possible for the positions of Kanpaku and Nairan to be filled at the same time.)
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って訳し直しました。「長者」とはwealthy positionの意味ではなく、「氏を統率する人」という意味です。in exchange for cancelingの部分に原文の「留任」が反映されるように訳し直しました。「（関白と内覧が並存する事はこれまでありえなかった）。」を訳出しました。人名修正NR: There seems to be some repetition in the translation that I cannot see in the original Japanese so I've had to edit this quite heavily.

sen.e: However the Cloister Emperor Toba was not comfortable being involved in the personnel issue of Tadazane, after Emperor Konoe died suddenly, he cancelled Michinaga's positon of Nairan, this incident caused the Hogen War later on.
